request_pathways.name: Authorization for Release of Health Information
Fax submission to Lane County Hospital or Lane County Medical Clinic

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patient must use a generic third-party authorization form, filling in themselves as both authorizer and recipient, then fax it to the hospital.

red_flags: Social Security Number requested — not required for HIPAA processing and creates identity theft risk on a faxed form
Witness signature line creates implicit requirement not mandated by HIPAA
Cryptic 'RESOURCE: MARKETING AUTHORIZATION FORM' reference at bottom may confuse patients about the form's purpose
bright_spots: Exceptionally easy to find — one click from a clearly labeled Records Request page
Granular record-type selection with 16 distinct categories giving patients meaningful control
Kansas SB 119 citation for one-year authorization expiration — a useful compliance detail
Clear revocation instructions with named Privacy Officer and full contact information

findability.rationale: Level 5: Prominently available with minimal effort — form is one click from a clearly labeled Records Request page found immediately via basic web search.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: Usable digitally with workarounds; fax submission available — the PDF has a text layer enabling annotation but zero fillable fields require print-and-handwrite, with fax as the electronic submission option.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized with minor clarity issues — single-page form with logical flow and 16 granular record-type checkboxes, but marred by title typo, duplicate checkbox, and cryptic footer reference.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the process but it wasn't designed for them — the third-party release structure forces patients to figure out how to repurpose the form for self-access with no guidance.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: Some requirements that go beyond what the law requires — SSN collection and witness signature line are not required by HIPAA for patient access and create unnecessary barriers, though revocation and expiration language are solid.

overall.summary: Lane County Hospital makes its form exceptionally easy to find and keeps it concise with good record-type granularity, but the generic third-party authorization design, non-fillable format, SSN request, and witness line prevent it from achieving a patient-centered standard.
